verses.roman:
"nirgranthāḥ"--avidyā-hīna, keha--vidhi-hīna
yāhāṅ yei yukta, sei arthera adhīna

synonyms: nirgranthāḥ—nirgranthāḥ; avidyā-hīna—without ignorance; keha—some of them; vidhi-hīna—without following any regulative principles; yāhāṅ—wherever; yei—which; yukta—appropriate; sei arthera adhīna—comes under that different import.
translation: "The word nirgranthāḥ means 'without ignorance' and 'devoid of rules and regulations.' Whichever meaning fits may be applied.
